doc.author: Rohit Thakur (@rohitthakur)
description: This module manages global bgp configuration on devices running Juniper JUNOS.
notes: This module requires the netconf system service be enabled on the device being managed.
This module works with connection C(netconf). See L(the Junos OS Platform Options,../network/user_guide/platform_junos.html).

config.description: A list of BGP process configuration.

accept_remote_nexthop.description: Allow import policy to specify a non-directly connected next-hop.

add_path_display_ipv4_address.description: Display add-path path-id in IPv4 address format.

conditional.description: Route matches active route upto med-comparison rule.

advertise_from_main_vpn_tables.description: Advertise VPN routes from bgp.Xvpn.0 tables in master instance.

advertise_peer_as.description: Advertise routes received from the same autonomous system.

loose_check.description: Verify authentication only if authentication is negotiated.

threshold.description: Specify high detection-time triggering a trap (milliseconds).

holddown_interval.description: Specify time to hold the session-UP notification to the client.

minimum_interval.description: Specify minimum transmit and receive interval.

threshold.description: Specify high transmit interval triggering a trap.

malformed_route_limit.description: Maximum number of malformed routes from a peer.

malformed_update_log_interval.description: Time used when logging malformed update.

bmp.description: Specific settings to override the routing-options settings.

none.description: Do not send route montoring messages.

post_policy.description: Send post policy route montoring messages.

post_policy_exclude_non_eligible.description: Send post policy route montoring messages and exclude unresolved routes, etc.

post_policy_exclude_non_feasible.description: Send pre policy route montoring messages and exclude looped routes, etc.

pre_policy.description: Send pre policy route montoring messages.

backup_path.description: The 'egress-te-backup-paths template' to use for this peer.

egress_te_backup_paths.description: Backup-path for Egress-TE peer interface failure.

peer_addr.description: Specify address of BGP peer to use as backup next-hop.

remote_nexthop.description: Specify address of remote-nexthop to use as backup path.

ip_forward.description: Use IP-forward backup path for Egress TE.

rti_name.description: Routing-instance to use as IP forward backup-path.

set.description: Set use IP-forward backup path for Egress TE.

egress_te_backup_segment_label.description: BGP-Peer-Set SID label value from static label pool.

label.description: Backup segment label value from static label pool.

enforce_first_as.description: Enforce neighbor AS is the first AS in AS-PATH attribute (EBGP).

forwarding_context.description: Specify routing-instance used for data-forwarding and transport-session.

dont_help_shared_fate_bfd_down.description: Honor BFD-Down(C=0) if GR-restart not in progress.

as_rr_client.description: As for a route reflector client.

from_fib.description: Always use state of associated FIB(s).

advertise_to_non_llgr_neighbor.description: Advertise stale routes to non-LLGR neighbors.

omit_no_export.description: Set Advertise stale routes to non-LLGR neighbors.

set.description: Set Advertise stale routes to non-LLGR neighbors.

restart_time.description: Restart time used when negotiating with a peer.

stale_routes_time.description: Maximum time for which stale routes are kept.

hold_time.description: Specify hold time used when negotiating with a peer.

holddown_all_stale_labels.description: Hold all BGP stale-labels, facilating make-before-break for new label advertisements.

idle_after_switch_over.description: Stop peer session from coming up after nonstop-routing switch-over.

forever.description: Idle the peer until the user intervenes.

timeout.description: Specify timeout value, in seconds, for starting peer after switch over.

include_mp_next_hop.description: Include NEXT-HOP attribute in multiprotocol updates.

keep.description: Specify how to retain routes in the routing table.

local_address.description: Specify Address of local end of BGP session.

alias.description: Treat this AS as an alias to the system AS.

as_num.description: Autonomous system number in plain number or (asdot notation) format.

loops.description: Maximum number of times this AS can be in an AS path.

no_prepend_global_as.description: Maximum number of times this AS can be in an AS path.

private.description: Hide this local AS in paths learned from this peering.

local_interface.description: Specify Local interface for IPv6 link local EBGP peering.

local_preference.description: Specify value of LOCAL_PREF path attribute.

log_updown.description: Enable log a message for peer state transitions.

metric_out.description: Specify route metric sent in MED.

delay_med_update.description: Delay updating MED when IGP metric increases.

set.description: Set track the minimum IGP metric.

no_nexthop_change.description: Do not change next hop to self in advertisements.

multipath.description: Allow load sharing among multiple BGP paths.

set.description: Set allow load sharing among multiple BGP paths.

no_advertise_peer_as.description: Allows to not advertise routes received from the same autonomous system.

no_aggregator_id.description: Set router ID in aggregator path attribute to 0.

no_precision_timers.description: Specify not to use precision timers for scheduling keepalives.

out_delay.description: Specify how long before exporting routes from routing table.

bgp_orf_cisco_mode.description: Using BGP ORF capability code 130 and Prefix ORF type 128.

accept.description: Honor Prefix-based ORFs from remote peers.

set.description: Set honor Prefix-based ORFs from remote peers.

output_queue_priority.description: BGP output queue priority scheduler for updates.

defaults.description: Map policy's priority class and BGP output-queue.

high.description: Assign the 'high' priority class to this output-queue.

low.description: Assign the 'low' priority class to this output-queue.

medium.description: Assign the 'medium' priority class to this output-queue.

priority.description: Output queue priority; higher is better.

passive.description: Specify to not send open messages to a peer.

always_compare_med.description: Compare MED on paths from different AS.

as_path_ignore.description: Ignore AS path comparison during path selection.

cisco_non_deterministic.description: Use Cisco IOS nondeterministic path selection algorithm.

external_router_id.description: Compare router ID on BGP externals.

l2vpn_use_bgp_rules.description: Use standard BGP rules during L2VPN path selection.

med_plus_igp.description: Add IGP cost to next-hop to MED before comparing MED values.

igp_multiplier.description: Specify multiplier for IGP cost to next-hop.

peer_as.description: Specify Autonomous system number in plain number or 'higher 16bits'.'Lower 16 bits' format.

precision_timers.description: Use precision timers for scheduling keepalives.

all.description: Remove all private AS numbers and do not stop at the first public AS number.

nearest.description: Use closest public AS number to replace a private AS number.

set.description: Replace private AS numbers with the BGP Group's local AS number.

rfc6514_compliant_safi129.description: Specify Compliance with RFC6514 SAFI129 format.

snmp_options.description: Customize SNMP behaviors specifically for BGP MIBs.

backward_traps_only_from_established.description: Limit traps for backward transitions to only those moving from Established state.

emit_inet_address_length_in_oid.description: Emit Length in OID for InetAddress MIB type.

sr_preference_override.description: Replace received segment routing traffic engineering preference value with override value.

stale_labels_holddown_period.description: Specify duration (sec) MPLS labels allocated by BGP are kept after they go stale.

tcp_aggressive_transmission.description: Enable aggressive transmission of pure TCP ACKs and retransmissions.

file_name.description: Specify name of file in which to write trace information.

files.description: Specify maximum number of trace files.

no_world_readable.description: Don't allow any user to read the log file.

world_readable.description: Allow any user to read the log file.

filter.description: Filter to apply to this flag.

set.description: Set filter to apply to this flag.
Set Trace all BGP protocol packets.

filter.description: Filter to apply to this flag.

set.description: Set filter to apply to this flag.
Set Trace threaded update I/O processing.
Set Trace routing protocol timer processing.

traffic_statistics_labeled_path.description: Collect periodic ingress labeled statistics for BGP label-switched paths.

file_name.description: Specify name of file in which to write trace information.

files.description: Specify maximum number of trace files.

no_world_readable.description: Don't allow any user to read the log file.

world_readable.description: Allow any user to read the log file.

interval.description: Specify time interval to collect statistics.

ttl.description: Specify TTL value for the single-hop peer.

unconfigured_peer_graceful_restart.description: Specify BGP unconfigured peer graceful restart options.

vpn_apply_export.description: Apply BGP export policy when exporting VPN routes.

description: This option is used only with state I(parsed).
The value of this option should be the output received from the NX-OS device by executing the command B(show running-config | section '^router bgp').

The state I(parsed) reads the configuration from C(running_config) option and transforms it into Ansible structured data as per the resource module's argspec and the value is then returned in the I(parsed) key within the result.
The state the configuration should be left in.

doc.short_description: Manages BGP Global configuration on devices running Juniper JUNOS.

after.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

before.description: The configuration prior to the model invocation.
before.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

commands.description: The set of commands pushed to the remote device.
sample: <nc:protocols xmlns:nc="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:netconf:base:1.0"> <nc:bgp> <nc:damping/> <nc:egress-te-sid-stats/> <nc:authentication-algorithm>md5</nc:authentication-algorithm> <nc:description>This is configured with Junos_bgp resource module</nc:description> <nc:hold-time>5</nc:hold-time> <nc:bfd-liveness-detection> <nc:transmit-interval> <nc:minimum-interval>2</nc:minimum-interval> </nc:transmit-interval> <nc:minimum-receive-interval>4</nc:minimum-receive-interval> <nc:multiplier>10</nc:multiplier> <nc:no-adaptation/> <nc:version>automatic</nc:version> </nc:bfd-liveness-detection> <nc:bgp-error-tolerance> <nc:malformed-route-limit>20000000</nc:malformed-route-limit> </nc:bgp-error-tolerance> <nc:bmp> <nc:monitor>enable</nc:monitor> </nc:bmp> </nc:bgp> </nc:protocols>
